intro: Platylepis goudotii, commonly known as the African snowball, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Proteaceae family and is characterized by its dense, spherical clusters of white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are narrow and leathery, providing a striking contrast to the fluffy flower heads. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens.
